Creating new violence de-escalation programs + mental health teams to respond to certain 911 calls instead of police: 72%

Free childcare for infancy to age 3: 65%

Nationwide Support For Mamdani Policies:

Speeding up affordable housing approvals: 83%

Adding a 2% tax on income over $1 million: 72%

Raising corporate taxes: 72%

Data For Progress / Nov 3, 2025

Zohran Mamdani ran on freezing the rent in NYC.

Abigail Spanberger ran on supporting fired federal workers and lowering the cost of living in VA.

Mikie Sherrill ran on lowering utility bills in NJ.

Ensuring people can afford to live a decent life is the path forward.

So hear me, President Trump, when I say this: to get to any of us, you will have to get through all of us. When we enter City Hall in 58 days, expectations will be high. We will meet them. A great New Yorker once said that while you campaign in poetry, you govern in prose.

Small businesses account for over 90% of all companies in NYC and employ nearly half of all workers in the private sector. But the economic outlook for small businesses in New York state is dead last nationwide, and too many in our city are forced to close because staying open costs too much and navigating the bureaucracy is too difficult. That costs New Yorkers their jobs, small business owners their dreams, and our city the places that give it character.

We’re going to make it faster, easier, and cheaper to start and run a business:

✅ Cut fines and fees for small businesses in
half

✅ Speed up permitting and make online
applications easier

✅ Increase funding for 1:1 small business
support by 500 percent

record.text: texting with my dad, a former political speechwriter, about Mamdani’s oratorical fireworks last night

images.alt:
a text conversation with my dad about Zohran Mamdani’s acceptance speech.

me: did you see Mamdani’s speech?

dad: Hell of a speech!  Some great lines and inspiring vision. 

me: I’d love to know how much of it he wrote. we haven’t had speeches like that since Obama

dad: I suspect he did a lot on his own, even as he drew on phrases or concepts voiced by others. Of course there was Ghandi [sic] and Debs, but I also heard King, Kennedy, FDR, Malcolm X, and the spirits of the suffragettes, the anti-robber barons, and other labor union leaders of the past two centuries.
